WRITING.TITLE: After the end of USSR, what happened with those that were arrested under the regime?
WRITING.TEXT: I watch a series called The Americans and in one episode a KGB officer said that even stealing a pen could be considered a crime of treason, thus that lead me to think that many were arrested without a real reason, or worse they weren't granted a fair trial. So what happened with those that committed "crimes" against the regime: did they have to complete their sentences? Did they have to go through another trial? Were they compensated financially for this unfairness towards them? Is this a stain in Russia's history? Are there people that were "forgotten" and their relatives still protest today?

I also thought I remembered that, but I thought it could be the Mandella effect working
Edit: by that I mean Hades always fighting Pegasus

In Next Dimension there is also a Pegasus called Tenma, we don't know yet if this Tenma will fight Hades, but it is possible that he will. In the last chapter of the manga you can see that Hades says: "[He is identical to the only **man** able to hurt me.](https://lermangasonline.xyz/sys_mangas/00sdfrw/S/Saint%20Seiya/cap_48/0031.jpg)" Remember when the Poseidon arc started and both [Saori and Julian knew they knew each other for centuries](https://lermangasonline.xyz/sys_mangas/00sdfrw/S/Saint%20Seiya/cap_23/0006.jpg)? Basically what they meant here is that a god can recognise another god even if Poseidon wasn't supposed to reincarnate in Julian - he was forced by Kanon. I think that Pegasus is the knight destined to protect Athena, much like how, possibly, Sorrento is Poseidon's Marina "protector".
Favourite child or not, I don't see the connection here, specially if you consider Seiya as "Zeus' reincarnated", if he was sent to protect her, is more likely, but still I am not one for this theory, maybe you will find someone else that agrees with you.

No, he is not. As /u/redditismyhigh said Hades was talking about the ancient Pegasus Saint, I don't think he meant Tenma from Lost Canvas since this series isn't canon, but another Pegasus Saint that would get in his way just like Athena did before.
I don't think Zeus would bother to send a human to protect his daughter, a goddess, and not only that Zeus lives in the Olympus, he doesn't care about Earth, for all he knows his brothers can kill each other and try to take care of Earth, he won't lose his seat. Another point worth mentioning is that in the Greek mythology Athena was born from Zeus' headache, Hephaestus - if I'm not mistaken - was the one that pulled Athena from his head; do you think he would bother with such an annoying daughter?
BTW, your first question is "Is Seiya the reincarnation of Zeus?" but then you wonder if Seiya isn't Zeus emissary, if any of those is possible I'd pick the latter, it wouldn't make sense a higher god appear to protect a "minor" god, it would be the same as saying Athena appeared to protect Nike (her staff).

I lost some friends because of the "blood comes first" policy that some relatives used to tell me, I tried to reconnect with them - my then friends - years later, I'm not sure if they were still upset with me or they simply didn't care about me anymore. So if I have the chance to teach someone something that would be: "family comes first, but friends are the family that you pick", don't make the same mistake that I did.

Of course, when Luffy noticed that he wasn't able to fight back Kuma he tried to retreat; when Ace first faced Whitebeard and saw that he wasn't strong enough he would sacrifice himself so the Spade's Pirates could run; when Hakuba was about to strike Robin, Cavendish could partially regain control of his body.
There are some examples of people being in danger that weren't lucky, but you don't find it very often in OP.

Just like what Monet said: "the strongest doesn't always win" as she freezes him but **bang** plot armour activates Luffy, as he freezes, hear his crewmembers saying motivational things and suddenly the cold is gone.
Maybe I'm being to harsh, but a series doesn't live that long if it isn't good, I just hope it keeps getting even better.
"Neptune"

You said they've been in danger, but it's hard to notice, so once again since you noticed give me an example. Dressrosa: was a combination of the new admiral policy against the shichibukai plus the people cheering for the pirates; Marineford: Shanks appeared; Impel Down: oh look a ship was here waiting for us, oh look Bon-chan stayed behind to close the gates; Enies Lobby: oh look Merry was waiting for us, oh look Aokiji didn't capture them even after buster call. No danger, just luck, now luck at Ace, for instance had his crewmate killed, got arrested by Blackbeard (even when Shanks asked Ace's retreat to Whitebeard) and killed by Akainu (because Luffy didn't pay attention) he was in real danger all the time, nothing saved him.
Even though I'm might sound like one, I'm not trying to be a douche, we just have to accept that Luffy wasn't in real danger he is just lucky.
Give an example of real danger that Lady Luck didn't appear.
Are we Romans here?
Why is his right arm shaved?

Honestly there are a few things to consider as well, for instance Luffy was only able to beat Cracker because Nami was with him, and Luffy was only able to get rid of ~~Kakashi~~ Katakuri because Jinbe helped, but I think that some people forget about some people that Luffy fought but were actually pretty strong. Enel is the greatest example, how many people in Grand Line or even the New World do you think would be able to beat him?
Another point that we should raise is Luffy's luck, besides Sabaody how many times were Luffy and the crew really in danger? What they lack in power they have in luck.

WRITING.TITLE: What are some examples of dialogues that change depending on your status of the gameplay?
WRITING.TEXT:
In **Bleak Falls Barrow**, you might have picked the Dragonstone before talking to Farengar.
In the quest **Sovngarde** when facing Tsun you might pick:
1. *"Ah! It's been too long since last I faced a doom-driven hero of the dragon blood."*
2. *"I welcome the chance to challenge the blade of Ysgramor's heir, honored shield-brother/sister to Kodlak Whitemane, whom I've watched for in vain."*
3. *"Well met, mage of Skyrim. The Nords may have forgotten their forefathers' respect for the Clever Craft, but your comrades throng this hall. Here in Shor's house we honor it still."*.
4. *"You tresspass here, shadow-walker. Shor does not know you. Perhaps before the end you will earn the right to pass this way. Welcome I do not offer, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand."*.
5. *"Do not mistake the night-shrouded thief's stealthily-taken spoils, stolen and unearned, for a warrior's plunder, won in honorable battle. Your doom already binds you to your dark mistress, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand."*
In **Dawnguard** there are three approaches you can have with Lord Harkon:
1. You are "normal";
2. You are a vampire - "*You contracted a disease, perhaps, but you are no true vampire. Accept my gift and I promise that you will learn the difference. Refuse me, and I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey.*";
3. You are a werewolf - "*Yes, I can smell it on you. The power of my blood will purge that filth and make you whole again.*"
In **Dragonborn**, if you are talking with Neloth you might bring up that you are the Archmage of the College of Winterhold
1. *"Winterhold? That small college that is falling into the Sea of Ghosts? You're the one that recovered the Staff of Magnus. Impressive. Talvas should finish his apprenticeship in a couple of decades. Come see me then. I think I could teach you a trick or two."*
Also, if you finished the Dragonborn quest or **Discerning the Transmundane**, Hermaeus Mora will recognise you, saying that he has been following you since Miraak's defeat or, if I'm not mistaken, that you are a knowledge seeker.

in the manga he says "45" he doesn't pronounce the number, the whole thing here is that 45 can be read "four" "five", instead of "forty-five", which will sound as "after death", just another pun for him.
